H0.text: Phases are the two distinct layers that form when oil and water do not mix.

H1.text: Changes are the two distinct layers that form when oil and water do not mix.

H2.text: Stages are the two distinct layers that form when oil and water do not mix.

H3.text: Surfaces are the two distinct layers that form when oil and water do not mix.

A4.text: A mixture of water (a polar liquid) and oil (a non-polar liquid) will spontaneously separate into two phases.

A5.text: Water has a very low solubility (is insoluble) in oil, and oil has a low solubility in water.
